Package fr.enstb.xmlcode

Provides functionalities to automatically encode/decode directly from/to objects to/from XML Strings/Streams
This package provides tools for easily and automatically serializing/deserializing Java objects to/from XML strings or streams.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
StringConvertable Instances of classes implementing this interface are able to be encoded to/from a string
StringRepresentable Instances of classes implementing this interface are able to be represented by a String
XMLSerializable Classes implementing interface XMLSerializable could be instancied and coded from/to XML strings and streams.
 

Class Summary
AccessorMethod AccessorMethod is a class representing a KeyValueProperty accessor method.
ArrayKeyValueProperty A KeyValue property represents a array property, accessible directly by related field or related accessors.
Cloner Utility class providing cloning facilities
Debugging Utility class providing debugging facilities
HashtableKeyValueProperty A HashtableKeyValueProperty property represents a hashtable-like property, accessible directly by related field or related accessors.
KeyValueCoder KeyValueCoder is an utility class that allow to manipulate (set methods) properties of object (field or get/set methods pair) from values represented as String (very usefull for xml coding/decoding) Those operations are done using the java.lang.reflect package and all developments done in KeyValueProperty class.
KeyValueDecoder KeyValueDecoder is an utility class that allow to manipulate (get methods) properties of object (field or get/set methods pair) from values represented as String (very usefull for xml coding/decoding) Those operations are done using the java.lang.reflect package and all developments done in KeyValueProperty class.
KeyValueProperty A KeyValue property represents a property, accessible directly by related field or through accessors methods (get/set pair for single properties (see SingleKeyValueProperty), addTo..
ModelEntity ModelEntity is internally used in XMLMapping You never need to used it directly, this class maps <entity> tags in model file.
ModelProperty ModelProperty is internally used in XMLMapping You never need to used it directly, this class maps <property> tags in model file.
PropertiesKeyValueProperty A PropertiesKeyValueProperty property represents a hashtable-like property, accessible directly by related field or related accessors: this property matches a dynamic list of objects stored in a Hashtable or a sub-class of Hashtable where key is a String obtained and parsed from/as XML element name: therefore, there is no need to implement model for contained data
SingleKeyValueProperty A KeyValue property represents a single-like property, accessible directly by related field or related accessors.
StringEncoder Utility class used to encode objects
StringEncoder.BooleanConverter Class defining how to convert Boolean from/to String
StringEncoder.ClassConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to Class
StringEncoder.Converter Abstract class defining a converter to and from a String for a given class
StringEncoder.DateConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to Date
StringEncoder.FileConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to File
StringEncoder.IntegerConverter Class defining how to convert Integer from/to String
StringEncoder.NumberConverter Class defining how to convert Number from/to String (try to deserialize - in this order - as an (1) integer, (2) float (3) double)
StringEncoder.PointConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to Class
StringEncoder.StringConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to String (easy !)
StringEncoder.URLConverter Class defining how to convert String from/to URL
VectorKeyValueProperty A KeyValue property represents a vector-like property, accessible directly by related field or related accessors.
XMLCoder Utility class providing XML coding facilities This class allow you to encode object to an XML string or streams according to a mapping you define externaly (see XMLMapping).
XMLDecoder Utility class providing XML decoding facilities This class allow you to decode object to an XML string or streams according to a mapping you define externaly (see XMLMapping).
XMLMapId  
XMLMapping XMLMapping class represent a mapping that will be used for xml coding/decoding process.
 

Exception Summary
AccessorInvocationException Exception thrown when invoking a class accessor during coding or decoding process.
InvalidDataException Exception thrown when trying to decode an object from invalid data regarding a given mapping or model file.
InvalidKeyValuePropertyException Exception thrown when trying to handle invalid key-value properties.
InvalidModelException Exception thrown when trying to manipulate invalid XML model
InvalidObjectSpecificationException Exception thrown when trying to manipulate an object (coding, decoding) invalid regarding an XML model.
InvalidXMLDataException Exception thrown when trying to decode an object from invalid XML data regarding a given mapping or model file.
 

Package fr.enstb.xmlcode Description

Provides functionalities to automatically encode/decode directly from/to objects to/from XML Strings/Streams


This package provides tools for easily and automatically serializing/deserializing Java objects to/from XML strings or streams. It provides a way to easily implement an XML persistent object model. It features support for a scheme for accessors methods use, support for an advanced inheritance scheme, native support for array, vector, and hashtable data structures, as well as native support to serialize/deserialize graph structures (cross-referenced objects).

Suppose that you have following XML data:
  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
  <command quantity="3" commandIsAlreadyPaid="yes"> 
    <customer>
      <name>Ringle</name>
    </customer> 
    <movie name="Alien">
      here comes a description of the movie
      <date>2001.09.18 AD at 09:54:58 AM CEST</date> 
      <cat>Horror</cat> 
      <role name="Brett"></role> 
      <role name="Kane"></role>
      <role name="Dallas"></role> 
      <role name="Parker"></role> 
    </movie> 
  </command>
and that you will map it to following objects: 
   public class Command {
     public int qty;
     public boolean commandIsAlreadyPaid;
     public Movie movie;
     public Customer customer;
   }
 
   public class Movie {
     public String title;
     public String description;
     public Date dateReleased;
     public Vector roles;
     public String category;
   }
 
   public class Customer { 
     public String name;
   }
 
   public class Role {
     public String roleName;
   }
you will define a model file defining this mapping such as: 
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
    <model> 
      <entity name="yourpackage.Command" xmlTag="command"> 
        <property name="qty" xmlTag="quantity" attribute="YES"/> 
        <property name="commandIsAlreadyPaid" xmlTag="commandIsAlreadyPaid" attribute="YES"/> 
        <property name="movie" xmlTag="movie"/> 
        <property name="customer" xmlTag="customer"/> 
      </entity> 
      <entity name="yourpackage.Customer" xmlTag="customer"> 
        <property name="name" xmlTag="name"/> 
      </entity> 
      <entity name="yourpackage.Movie" xmlTag="movie"> 
        <property name="title" xmlTag="name" attribute="YES"/> 
        <property name="description" text="YES"/>
        <property name="dateReleased" xmlTag="date"/> 
        <property name="roles" xmlTag="role" type="vector"/> 
        <property name="category" xmlTag="cat"/> 
      </entity> 
      <entity name="yourpackage.Role" xmlTag="role"> 
        <property name="roleName" xmlTag="name" attribute="YES"/> 
      </entity> 
    </model>
Decoding process will be simpler as this: 
    XMLMapping myMapping = new XMLMapping (exampleModelFile);
    Command myCommand = (Command)XMLDecoder.decodeObjectWithMapping (myData, myMapping);
or directly by specifying model file: 
    Command myCommand = (Command)XMLDecoder.decodeObjectWithMappingFile (myData, exampleModelFile);
where myData is either a String or an mInputStream and exampleModelFile is a File representing model file.
In this example, a new instance of yourpackage.Command class is instancied and automatically sets with values and newly created instances of others sub-classes (here yourpackage.Command, yourpackage.Movie, yourpackage.Customer and yourpackage.Role) and returned.
The reverse operation is as simpler just by doing: 
    XMLMapping myMapping = new XMLMapping (exampleModelFile);
    String result = XMLCoder.encodeObjectWithMapping (myCommand, myMapping);
or 
    String result = XMLCoder.encodeObjectWithMappingFile (myCommand, exampleModelFile);
if you want to work with String objects,
but you can directly work with OutputStream objects, by doing: 
    XMLMapping myMapping = new XMLMapping (exampleModelFile);
    XMLCoder.encodeObjectWithMapping (myCommand, myMapping, out);
or 
    XMLCoder.encodeObjectWithMappingFile (myCommand, exampleModelFile, out);
where out is a OutputStream object.

Some remarks on that process:

  • This code is based on SAX parser (JAX1.1)
  • All valid types (interpreted and manipulated as it) are all the java primitives (int, long, short, double, float, boolean, byte, char) and Date and String objects. Other needs could be easily implemented.

See README file which should be in this distribution to see how to compile and run this example

Author:
Sylvain Guerin
